survival_rates.description: Survival (time to re-revision) after a first revision procedure. Based on data from 2003 onwards.
survival_rates.exact_quote: The cumulative 15-year risk for primary total hip replacements (THRs) performed from 2003 onwards is 7.9% ± 0.2%... This risk increases significantly with subsequent revisions: 22.2% ± 0.8% after the first revision (2,294 observations)...

survival_rates.description: Survival (time to re-revision) after a second revision procedure. Based on data from 2003 onwards.
Survival (time to re-revision) for hips revised at least twice previously. Based on data from 2003 onwards.
survival_rates.exact_quote: ...and 35.5% ± 3.4% for hips revised at least twice previously (116 observations).

revision_reasons.description: Aseptic loosening, including osteolysis and/or wear. Data for all revisions 2003-2023.
revision_reasons.table_reference: Text, referencing Figure 5.4.7 a and b

revision_reasons.description: Periprosthetic fracture. Data for all revisions 2003-2023.
revision_reasons.table_reference: Text, referencing Figure 5.4.7 a and b

provenance_notes: Data extracted from Section 5.4 'Revision Hip Replacement'. Procedure counts (n_procedures, n_primary) are for the period 2014-2023 from Table 5.4.1. Survival and revision reason data are for the period 2003-2023.
